rules: Rule1: If medication X receives regulatory approval, then it is quality certified.
Rule2: Under the condition that medication X undergoes batch testing, if it is quality certified, then market release occurs.
Rule3: Either medication X undergoes batch testing or it undergoes accelerated review.
Rule4: In the event that medication X undergoes accelerated review, then if it is quality certified, market release follows.
Rule5: Whenever medication X passes trials, it is approved.
Rule6: Provided that medication X passes inspection, the pharmaceutical company is profitable.
Rule7: If medication X is authorized for emergency use, then it is not contaminated.
Rule8: Either medication X has safety issues or it is authorized for emergency use.
Rule9: Under the condition that medication X has an alternative formula, it does not have safety issues.
Rule10: Medication X has an alternative formula or it is reformulated.
Rule11: In the event that medication X is reformulated, it does not have safety issues.
Rule12: If it is not the case that medication X passes trials or passes inspection, then it is contaminated.
Rule13: Provided that it is not the case that medication X undergoes clinical trials or does not have safety issues, regulatory approval follows.
facts: Fact1: Medication X is not approved.
Fact2: Medication X does not have market release.
Fact3: Medication X does not undergo clinical trials.
